author: Priya Pareek
title: 'ULFA To Be Disbanded': Amit Shah On Historic Peace Deal With Assam's Oldest Insurgent Group | India News, Times Now
text: 'ULFA To Be Disbanded': Amit Shah On Historic Peace Deal With Assam's Oldest Insurgent Group Notably, the peace accord came after 12 years of unconditional negotiations between the ULFA faction led by Arabinda Rajkhowa and the government. A 29-member delegation of the ULFA's pro-talks delegation, including 16 ULFA members and 13 from civil society, signed the agreement. 'ULFA To Be Disbanded': Amit Shah On Historic Peace Deal With Oldest Insurgent Group Of Assam Photo : ANI New Delhi: Union Home Minister Amit Shah today celebrated the historic peace deal of United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) with the Central government and the Assam government. The peace deal was inked in the presence of Amit Shah and chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. A 29-member delegation of the ULFA's pro-talks delegation, including 16 ULFA members and 13 from civil society, signed the agreement. The deal comes after a series of talks with officials concerned in the Central government since the delegation arrived in Delhi on December 26. Amit Shah said that Centre will ensure all the reasonable demands by ULFA will be met in a time-bound manner, and ULFA as an organisation will be disbanded. The Home Minister said with this Memorandum of Settlement, the ULFA faction has formally agreed to shun violence and join the mainstream. He added that ULFA signing the memorandum signals the start of a new period of peace for the entire Northeast and especially for Assam. Amit Shah said the state has been suffering for a long time due to the violence involving the insurgent group and 10,000 people have been killed in such violence since 1979. “It is a matter of joy for me that today is a bright day for the future of Assam. For a long time, Assam, Northeast faced violence and after Prime Minister Narendra Modi became PM in 2014, efforts were made to reduce the gap between Delhi and Northeast", said Amit Shah. "I want to assure ULFA representatives that the faith you have kept in the government of India, from the Ministry of Home Affairs's side, a programme will be made in a time-bound manner to fulfil everything, without you having to ask for it," said Shah and credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for bringing peace and stability in the northeast. He added that a committee will be formed under the Home Ministry which will work with the Assam government to fulfil the agreements under the memorandum. 'Historic Day' Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, who sat beside Shah, said the peace deal with ULFA will solve the problem of insurgency in the region to a large extent. “Today is a historic day for Assam. During PM Modi's tenure, under the guidance of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, work for Assam's peace was always underway...three accords have been signed and with three accords tribal militancy has come to an end in Assam", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. Notably, the peace accord came after 12 years of unconditional negotiations between the ULFA faction led by Arabinda Rajkhowa and the government. What is ULFA? ULFA is a separatist group formed in April 1979 in the aftermath of an agitation against undocumented immigrants from Bangladesh (erstwhile East Pakistan). In February 2011, it split into two groups with the Arabinda Rajkhowa-led faction giving up violence and agreeing to unconditional talks with the government. The group was labelled a terrorist organisation and banned in India since 1990. In 2011, the group had signed a tripartite agreement for Suspension of Operations (SoO) with the central government and the Assam government. Notably, Paresh Baruah, who leads the other rebranded ULFA-Independent faction, is against the peace talks. The Union government has signed peace deals with rebel Bodo, Dimasa, Karbi, and Adivasi outfits in Assam over the last three years. author: Le Journal de Québec
title: France: l'archipel de Mayotte en alerte rouge cyclonique
text: «On a très peur»: l’archipel français de Mayotte, dans l’océan Indien, a été placé en alerte rouge cyclonique vendredi soir en raison du passage du cyclone Chido, a annoncé le préfet. «L’heure est grave. Mayotte n’a jamais connu une telle situation», a déclaré le président du conseil départemental, Ben Issa Ousseni, alors que le cyclone, à environ 300 km au nord-est de Mayotte selon le dernier bulletin de Météo-France, pourrait s’accompagner de «vents destructeurs voire dévastateurs». L’alerte rouge est entrée en vigueur à 22 h sur l’archipel. «C’est un événement inédit, d’une extrême violence, les vents pourront dépasser 180 km/h», a expliqué de son côté le préfet François-Xavier Bieuville lors d’une conférence de presse. Il a appelé les personnes logées dans des habitations précaires, très nombreuses dans le département le plus pauvre de France, à se confiner dans l’un des 71 centres d’hébergement ouverts par les autorités dans des établissements scolaires et gymnases. Chido est un «cyclone tropical intense», explique l’institut météorologique Météo-France, qui prévoit «de violentes rafales de vents, des pluies intenses, des vagues submersives couplées à une surélévation de la mer». Ces conditions météorologiques fortement dégradées entraînent «un risque de ruissellement et d’inondation, et une houle marine qui peut avoir des effets importants sur le littoral» a ajouté M. Bieuville, qui a enjoint les bateaux à «impérativement rejoindre la terre ferme». Toute circulation sur la voie publique est interdite depuis 22 h locales et l’aéroport de Dzaoudzi est fermé depuis 20 h locales. Le ministère français de l’Intérieur avait annoncé jeudi l’envoi à Mayotte de 110 professionnels de la sécurité civile depuis l’île de La Réunion. Tous les établissements scolaires de l’archipel sont fermés vendredi et samedi. Alerte orange aux Comores «J’ai fait le plein de bouteilles d’eau, de nourriture, de bougies...», témoigne Fatima, habitante de Majicavo-Koropa et mère de trois enfants, qui n’a pas donné son nom. «On a très peur», confie cette femme de 57 ans, encore marquée par le passage d’un cyclone quand elle était enfant aux Comores voisines, se souvenant des «vagues (qui) ravageaient tout» et des «poteaux électriques par terre». Mayotte, relativement épargnée par les cyclones, avait déjà été touchée par le cyclone Belna en 2019, qui n’avait cependant pas fait de dégât majeur. Aux Comores voisines, une alerte cyclonique de niveau orange a été activée par le ministère de l’Intérieur. La direction générale de la sécurité civile a ordonné la fermeture des aéroports à partir de vendredi 18 h locales «en raison des conditions météorologiques extrêmes.» A Madagascar, l’œil du cyclone s’est approché à une centaine de kilomètres du nord de l’île et a causé une pluie «abondante l’après-midi» ainsi qu’un «vent fort» avant de s’en éloigner, selon les autorités. «Plusieurs quartiers sont inondés» mais «le plus dur semble être derrière nous», a déclaré à l’AFP Cerveau Rakotoson, un habitant d’Antsiranana, principale ville du nord de l’île.

author: admin3
title: Democracia corre ‘perigo’, alerta Biden durante comemorações do ‘Dia D’ - ISTOÉ Independente
text:
O presidente dos Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, alertou nesta quinta-feira (6) na França que a democracia está “em perigo”, durante a comemoração do 80º aniversário do Desembarque na Normandia que ajudou a libertar a Europa da ocupação nazista.
Tendo como pano de fundo a invasão russa da Ucrânia, Biden, o seu homólogo francês Emmanuel Macron, o rei britânico Charles III e o primeiro-ministro canadense Justin Trudeau, prestaram homenagem às dezenas de milhares de soldados aliados que desembarcaram em 6 de junho de 1944 na Normandia, região do noroeste da França.
O presidente ucraniano, Volodimir Zelensky, também foi convidado para a cerimônia na praia de Omaha, em uma das quais ocorreu o desembarque.
“Vivemos em uma época em que a democracia corre mais perigo no mundo do que em qualquer momento desde o fim da Segunda Guerra Mundial”, disse Biden. “Alianças reais nos tornam mais fortes, uma lição que rezo para que nós, americanos, nunca esqueçamos”, acrescentou.
Na cidade francesa de Ver-sur-Mer, Charles III lembrou “com o mais profundo sentimento de gratidão” os soldados aliados e os civis franceses que perderam a vida durante o Desembarque na Normandia, assim como a coragem da resistência francesa.
“As nações livres devem se unir para se oporem à tirania”, disse ele.
Trudeau declarou, por sua vez, que a democracia está sendo “ameaçada por agressores que querem redesenhar as fronteiras”.
A grande ausência na cerimônia é a da Rússia.
Apesar do elevado preço que a União Soviética pagou na vitória final (27 milhões de mortes civis e militares), o presidente Vladimir Putin não foi convidado, ao contrário do que aconteceu há 10 anos. Deste modo, as potências ocidentais querem reafirmar seu apoio à Ucrânia.
A França e a ex-república soviética negociam o envio de instrutores militares franceses para a Ucrânia, e Zelensky deve expor as necessidades do seu país a Biden e Macron durante a sua visita.
“Os Aliados defenderam a liberdade da Europa naquela altura e os ucranianos o fazem agora. A unidade prevaleceu então e a verdadeira unidade pode prevalecer hoje”, afirmou o presidente ucraniano na rede social X.
– ‘Não fraquejaremos’ –
“Agradeço ao povo ucraniano pela sua coragem. Estamos aqui e não fraquejaremos”, disse Macron, que alertou em abril que a Europa “pode morrer” devido à ofensiva russa, enquanto os convidados aplaudiam Zelensky de pé.
Em uma entrevista à televisão francesa, Macron anunciou que seu país entregará caças Mirage-2000 à Ucrânia e treinará seus pilotos como parte da nova cooperação militar com Kiev.
O presidente francês também indicou que os aliados ocidentais considerariam um pedido da Ucrânia pelo envio de instrutores militares que treinem suas forças em seu território.
Além dos líderes ocidentais, Macron convidou para as comemorações cerca de 200 veteranos dos países aliados, os últimos sobreviventes das dezenas de milhares de soldados que arriscaram suas vidas nas praias arenosas e falésias da Normandia, sob intenso contra-fogo alemão.
“Não estou especialmente orgulhoso do que fiz, mas se tivesse que fazer de novo, faria. Estou feliz com nosso sacrifício para que outros possam ter uma vida boa”, disse o britânico John Mines, 99 anos, à AFP.
A líder da extrema direita francesa, Marine Le Pen, acusou Macron de usar as comemorações do Dia D para “tentar obter vantagem política” no contexto das atuais eleições europeias, em que partidos deste espectro poderão registrar um forte crescimento, segundo pesquisas.
Biden, que permanecerá na França até domingo, tem a mira apontada para a campanha das eleições presidenciais de novembro contra Donald Trump, nas quais o democrata busca um segundo mandato.
– ‘O Mais Longo dos Dias’ –
Em uma operação preparada com máximo sigilo, os Aliados desembarcaram há 80 anos em cinco praias da costa da Normandia: os americanos em Omaha e Utah, os britânicos em Gold e Sword, e os britânicos e canadenses em Juno.
O desembarque, apoiado pelo lançamento de paraquedistas na França ocupada, foi a maior operação anfíbia da história em termos de número de navios e soldados mobilizados.
No final do que ficou conhecido como “O Mais Longo dos Dias”, 156 mil soldados aliados e 20 mil veículos chegaram ao noroeste da França sob bombardeios e ataques aéreos alemães.
Esta operação marcou o início do fim da ocupação nazista da Europa Ocidental, embora ainda houvesse meses de combates intensos e sangrentos antes da vitória final sobre o regime de Adolf Hitler em maio de 1945.

title: The mysterious death of paranormal investigator Dan Rivera during 'Devils on the Run' tour with 'Possessed' Annabelle doll - The Economic Times
text: Dan Rivera, a 54-year-old paranormal investigator and U.S. Army veteran, died under mysterious circumstances on Sunday, July 13, 2025, while on tour with the infamous Annabelle doll in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. Rivera, a lead investigator with the New England Society for Psychic Research (NESPR), was staying at a local hotel during his “Devils on the Run” tour when emergency responders were called to the scene. Despite CPR efforts, he was pronounced dead at the hotel. His cause of death remains unknown. 121396523 Rivera was a well-known figure in the paranormal community, having appeared on various supernatural television programs and serving as a consulting producer for Netflix’s 28 Days Haunted. His latest tour, which featured the notorious Annabelle doll—believed by many to be demonically possessed—had just wrapped up a sold-out, three-day stop at Gettysburg’s historic Soldiers National Orphanage, hosted by Ghostly Images of Gettysburg Tours. Rivera’s death was confirmed by both NESPR and the tour organizers. The society paid tribute to him in a Facebook post on Monday, July 14, saying: “We are heartbroken and still processing this loss. Dan truly believed in sharing his experiences and educating people on the paranormal. His kindness and passion touched everyone who knew him. Thank you for your support and kind thoughts during this difficult time.” Fellow paranormal investigator Ryan Buell also shared an emotional tribute on TikTok: “I have so many amazing memories with this guy. Just two months ago, we were traveling across the country introducing a new generation to Ed and Lorraine Warren’s legacy.” Rivera was active on social media, particularly TikTok, where he regularly shared behind-the-scenes footage and stories from his investigations. He was instrumental in bringing renewed attention to the work of Ed and Lorraine Warren, the founders of NESPR, whose real-life cases inspired The Conjuring film franchise.All about Annabelle doll The Annabelle doll, a Raggedy Ann toy, became infamous in the 1970s after being linked to a series of paranormal disturbances. According to NESPR, the doll was originally gifted to a student nurse in 1968. Soon after, she and her roommate reportedly experienced strange and violent phenomena involving the doll. A medium told them it was inhabited by the spirit of a young girl named Annabelle—but the encounters grew more malevolent. The Warrens concluded the doll was not haunted by a child’s spirit, but rather possessed by an evil entity, and they later sealed it in a glass case at their Connecticut occult museum for public safety. Following the deaths of Ed in 2006 and Lorraine in 2019, their daughter Judy and son-in-law Tony Spera took over NESPR and its infamous museum, which has been closed to the public since 2019 due to zoning issues. The Adams County Coroner’s Office has yet to release Rivera’s cause of death.

organizations.name: New England Society for Psychic Research

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: U.S.-Iran Tensions Surge Amid Evacuations and Nuclear Deal Deadlock | Headlines
text:
U.S.-Iran Tensions Surge Amid Evacuations and Nuclear Deal Deadlock
Amid escalating tensions, the U.S. is evacuating personnel from the Middle East, impacting oil prices and international relations. The U.S.-Iran nuclear talks remain stalled, with Trump indicating a significant risk of conflict. The situation has intensified security risks, prompting a U.S. State Department travel advisory update.
Amid rising tensions in the Middle East, the U.S. is moving non-emergency personnel from several countries in the region, impacting global oil prices and prompting widespread international concern. The State Department updated its travel advisory, reflecting heightened regional tensions, while foreign energy companies continue operations.
The ongoing U.S.-Iran nuclear talks have reached a stalemate, with President Trump explicitly stating Iran will not be allowed a nuclear weapon. The situation remains precarious, as potential evacuations of military dependents from regional bases further indicate the gravity of the threat.
The U.S.'s defensive posture resonates in updated advisories and authorized voluntary evacuations from Bahrain and Kuwait, emphasizing the complex diplomatic dance amid intensified risks. Regional tensions have been exacerbated by Iran's defense minister warning of possible strikes should diplomatic talk stall, signaling potential regional escalation.

author: Moneycontrol News
title: Pilot enters Jaipur airport on luggage trolley amid waterlogging. Watch
text: Jaipur experienced heavy rainfall on Thursday, leading to significant disruptions throughout the city, including severe waterlogging at Jaipur International Airport (JIA). The downpour left various areas submerged, causing inconvenience to residents and travelers alike. A video capturing a pilot's struggle to enter JIA amidst the flooding has gone viral on social media. The footage, shared by X user Veena Jain, showed the pilot navigating the waterlogged entrance with the assistance of an airport staff member pushing a trolley. Jain captioned the video, "This is Jaipur Adani Airport. Here pilots fly even before boarding a flight... trolley itself is enough to fly." #waterloggingThis is Jaipur Adani Airport Here Pilots fly even before boarding a flight... Trolley itself is enough to fly #CloudBurst #DelhiRains #Delhi #Modi pic.twitter.com/J5LMkt6PKl— Veena Jain (@DrJain21) August 1, 2024 The video began with a view of the airport entrance submerged in water. As the pilot attempted to make his way inside, he resorted to climbing onto a trolley to avoid wading through the flooded area. The airport staff member then pushed the trolley, allowing the pilot to reach the terminal dry. Since being shared, the video has garnered over 11,000 views, along with numerous likes and comments. One commenter remarked, "Everywhere there is the problem of proper drainage resulting in water logging. It's really a shame." Another user, Pratik Kumar Mishra, added, "Wow, what an entrance! I'm curious how the average traveller will get into the airport—maybe they'll need a boat, or is it an air+water port now?" "Where do they select engineers & architects from? Failed colleges? It's a joke or what. Everywhere it's the same story," a third user remarked.",

title: 军工ETF易方达（512560）跌2.00%，半日成交额2651.97万元|军工_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，军工ETF易方达（512560）跌2.00%，报0.637元，成交额2651.97万元。军工ETF易方达（512560）重仓股方面， 中国船舶 截止午盘跌2.15%， 光启技术 跌0.39%， 中航光电 跌2.33%， 航发动力 跌1.79%， 中国重工 跌2.01%， 中航沈飞 跌4.45%， 中航西飞 跌2.11%， 中国长城 跌1.25%， 中航机载 跌1.90%， 中国动力 跌1.21%。
军工ETF易方达（512560）业绩比较基准为 中证军工指数 ，管理人为易方达基金管理有限公司，基金经理为余海燕，成立（2017-07-14）以来回报为29.80%，近一个月回报为2.53%。

author: NewsBreak Original
title: UIUC basketball guard Terrence Shannon Jr. arrested for alleged rape in Lawrence
text: Illinois (UIUC) men's basketball guard Terrence Shannon Jr. turned himself in on a rape charge and posted bail at the Douglas County Jail on Thursday, according to a UIUC press release. Shannon traveled to Lawrence Thursday, where he was booked on a rape charge and posted a $50,000 bond, after the Douglas County District Attorney issued an arrest warrant for him on Wednesday. After posting a $50,000 bail, Shannon made the trip back to Champaign, Illinois, according to the UIUC press release. In accordance with Division of Intercollegiate Athletics (DIA) policy, Shannon was immediately suspended from all team activities, per the release. The alleged incident happened during a trip Shannon made as a spectator to the Illinois vs. Kansas football game in Lawrence on Friday, Sept. 8, per the UIUC press release. "He was not in Lawrence on official University business, not was he a member of the University's travel party," the press release said. The press release states DIA and UIUC officials were made aware of the Lawrence police investigation into the alleged incident in late September, but did not have enough information to take action until Wednesday. "The University and DIA have shown time and again that we have zero tolerance for sexual misconduct," UIUC Director of Athletics Josh Whitman said in the press release. "At the same time, DIA policy affords student-athletes appropriate levels of due process based on the nature and severity of the allegations. We will rely on that policy and our prior experience to manage this situation appropriately for the University and the involved parties." —
